item.title: Framing matters
item.description: Originally published on January 13, 2016 at grayiscolorful.blogspot.com Would you rather contribute to a charity with the goal of saving children’s lives or to a charity that aims at preventing the deaths of children? Both charities’ goals are identical, but many would prefer to contribute to the second charity rather to the first one. The first charity’s goal is framed as making a gain while the second is framed as preventing a loss.

item.title: How the Republicans and Netanyahu are helping Obama’s Iran deal
item.description: Originally published on May 3, 2015 at grayiscolorful.blogspot.com The Book of Genesis describes God’s decision to punish Sodom and Gomorrah for their wickedness. God tells Abraham about his intention, turning Abraham into an advocate for the two cities. In his new role, Abraham bargains with God over the threshold of evidence required to find Sodom and Gomorrah guilty. Step by step, Abraham succeeds in decreasing the number of righteous people required to demonstrate there is a reasonable doubt that the cities are guilty of wickedness.
